lead_intro: Join me as I unravel the mysteries behind five fun physics phenomena and their surprising explanations!

quiz.question: Why does cereal stick to a magnet according to the video?
quiz.explanation: Cereal sticks to a magnet due to the iron content in it, which makes it attracted to magnetic fields.

quiz.question: How can you find the center of mass of a cane or stick-type object?
choices: move fingers in towards the middle
quiz.answer: move fingers in towards the middle
quiz.explanation: By moving your fingers in towards the middle from the outside, you can find the center of mass of a cane or stick-type object.

quiz.question: Why does a phone rotate around the short axis when flipped end over end?
choices: short axis has least moment of inertia
long axis has least moment of inertia
intermediate axis has least moment of inertia
quiz.answer: short axis has least moment of inertia
quiz.explanation: When flipping a phone end over end, it rotates around the short axis due to it having the least moment of inertia compared to the other axes.

quiz.question: What causes an electrically charged object to deflect a stream of water?
quiz.explanation: An electrically charged object deflects a stream of water due to dissolved ions in the water, not solely because water is a polar molecule.

quiz.question: Why does a teabag rocket take off into the air when lit on fire?
choices: hot air inside expands and rises
quiz.answer: hot air inside expands and rises
quiz.explanation: A teabag rocket takes off into the air because the hot air inside expands, becomes less dense, and is pushed up by the cooler air around it, creating a convection current.
